cause.description:
The Souper Bowl of Caring began with a group of high school students in Columbia, SC and has grown to a national initiative to engage young people in the issues of hunger and poverty. This Super Bowl weekend event is a simple and fun service activity where 100% of all collections are donated directly to the charity selected by each participating group.
1. Young people can make a difference.
2. Ordinary people can do extraordinary things.
3. Hunger exists in every community.
cause.mission: To mobilize and inspire youth to fight hunger and poverty in their local communities.
cause.name: Souper Bowl of Caring
